reviews.title: the yaiza certainly has the x factor
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at this luxury hotel. In the main it was a fantastic and very memorable experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The design and layout of the hotel is like nothing we have ever seen before, and the room was lovely - very clean, extremely comfortable beds ( two large singles pushed together ), and tastefully decorated. Our " side seaview " turned out to be an optimistic description; if we could have seen through the greenery just a few feet away from the balcony maybe we could have glimpsed the sea.
reviews.title: Not memorable

likes.disliked: — single beds for honeymooners!! rudeness of staff

reviews.title: absolutely the best
reviews.text: We had booked bed and breakfast only - the breakfast buffet was amazing, lots of fresh fruit, all the types of bread, jams, spreads you could think of, cooked stuff, cold meats, cheeses, even strawberries and champagne if you wanted.
The prices in the hotel restaurants were breathtaking - 38 euros per person for a pizza buffet ?? and as usual the mini bar was extortionately priced but thats not unexpected.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: There was a good supermarket 5 minutes walk away so we went there for bottled water and bits and bobs.
reviews.title: Above average but doesn't warrant its *****L Rating

reviews.text: This hotel was almost perfect. Our room was so big, with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, lounge and very large balcony, I managed to lose my family sometimes! The hotel looks nice and the food in the hotel was excellent. In fact much better than the restaurants near by which we repeatedly tried but didn't like. The problem was the noise. Not only was there the usual thin walls problem you can get in cheaper hotels but a disco had opened up next door and it went on till the early hours the morning! Sadly for these reasons I would not return.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: Had a suite but the view was NOT at all wonderful. We overlooked a derelect piece of land with bits of rubbish all over the place. In the distance were some scruffy buildings and the odd abandoned car! It was far too expensive for what we were given unless the tour company involved had the poorest allocation of suites! Of course they denied this when I wrote to them.The hotel itself was attractive enough. It was peaceful and the clientel were pleasant and friendly.
reviews.title: Will return !

reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days from the 14th december and we found the hotel, extremely clean, friendly members of staff, fantastic selection of food from all the 5 star buffet restaurants. Fresh food cooked to order every night and a great choice for allthe famlily including an 11 year old and a 15 year old. We stayed in a family suite which was extremely comfortable and very well furnished, the only complaint was that the pool at the family suites was being re painted when we were there. The maid service was exxellent and rooms cleaned to 5 star standards every day twice. Turnback service and clean towels at night also a bonus.
reviews.title: Fantastic family 5 stas hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Thalasso spa was well worth a visit and could highly recommend the massage treatments. Pools around the main hotel were great, top pool heated and perfect for the children to swim in whilst the adults chilled on the very comfortable loungers.
reviews.title: Only for families with small children

likes.disliked: — Kids, kids and more kids everywhere

reviews.text: All areas very quite for first week which was ideal for us as we were in need of a complete rest, however it did get very busy on the Thursday before Christmas eith families of all ages and some very noisy, chldren and some parents also! Pool bar service excellent as was the food. Piano bar very relaxing in an evening. Reception staff very accomodating and helpful when ever we need anything.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: All in all a fabulous winter break and one we will certainly do again.
reviews.title: 5* treatment,can't wait to go back...

likes.liked: — Overall cleanliness, decor, comfort and service.
likes.disliked: — Rooms could do with some soundproofing

reviews.text: We booked through El Corte Ingles in Madrid and were assured a terrace with a view of a) the sea or b) the swimming pools. We got neither of the two. Our view was of palm trees right up to the terrace, no sea, no swimming pools.
reviews.title: Fantastic 2 Bed Family Suites

likes.liked: — 2 Bedroom Suites are great for families. Plenty of pool space & loungers. Kids club.
likes.disliked: — Lack of early dining for small children despite being advertised.

reviews.title: Really good 5* hotel
reviews.text: We spent 1 week here with our 2 children. In the taxi on the way to the Hotel the taxi driver said it was the best hotel on the island and I think they were not wrong. We got some really cheap flights with thomascookfly.com and thought we would splash out on a nice hotel which we booked through Relaxabroad.com. We have stayed in the Rubicon Palace before and had seen the Princess Yaizia hotel on a walk to Playa Blanca. The hotel is what you would expect from a 5* Hotel with large rooms, excellent facilities including Kikoland for the kids and a great location right in the centre of Playa Blanca. The only down side I would say is the windy Lanzarote weather this is typical in the Canaries.

reviews.title: Luxury 5*
reviews.text: This is an excellent 5* hotel with 5* staff. It has all the extras that you would expect from a 5* hotel. We had a suite with an exceptionally large double bed with beautiful bed linen, two double wardrobes, plenty of lighting and three sets of curtains to the windows. In the lounge were two settees, table and chairs, tv and two sets of curtains to the doors which led to the large balcony which had two chairs and a table. There was an excellently designed bathroom with a choice of three showers, one over the bath, a power shower and a hand held shower, there were two wash hand basins and a toilet with white towels. There was a choice of three restaurants for those people taking half board, an international, a mexican and an italian. You could pay extra to go to the Japanese or A La Carte restaurants. There was also a pool bar, an ice cream shop and a tapas bar all on site. There was a large swimming pool and also a Jacuzzi. There was a gymnasium and a Spa with a choice of many different massages.

reviews.title: Really excellent hotel
reviews.text: The only downside to this hotel was the self service restaurants which when we were there was over run with children and parents lacking thought for other diners. They allowed their children to serve themselves and walk around picking food off their plates and some even sat their toddlers on the self service buffet areas, with no thought for the hygiene of sitting a child on a surface where food is being served!

I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting luxury but if you don't want children running round the dining room, don't go until after the 6th January, which is when we found that most of the children went back to school.
reviews.title: Disappointing Stay AT Princess Yaizza

reviews.text: We spent a week at the Yaiza from 4-11 Jan 2007 - myself, my wife and our 2-year old daughter. It was all we'd hoped for - fantastic, large, clean and comfortable junior suite overlooking the pool and the sea. Fantastically warm welcome on arrival - cava for the adults, juice for my daughter and, most importantly, a wonderful, welcoming attitude - you really felt pleased to be there. Indeed, throughout our stay the vast majority of staff were brilliant - genuinely friendly, without giving the impression they were simply going through the motions.
reviews.title: Lanzagrotty? - We Loved it !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first week of October and had a great time.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised - could get used to this!

likes.disliked: — plenty of staff but not always prompt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was an unusual holiday choice for us as we usually tend towards independent travel/small hotels but after a busy summer we just wanted a rest somewhere hot. Now I'm a complete convert to a touch of big hotel luxury, incuding bucks fizz on arrival!
reviews.title: Far away from 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well laid out with the indoors and outdoors mingling in the design, there are lots of plants, wooden flooring and fresh air. Our room was fab (it was an ordinary 'double superior') it was big with separate dressing room/wardrobe, lounge area and great bathroom - oh and robes and slippers!
reviews.title: Have already booked for next year.

likes.disliked: — Would have liked a seperate shower.

reviews.text: We stayed on a b&b basis which was ideal as breakfast was plentiful and the restaurants of Playa Blanca only a 5 minute walk away. The hotel wasn't crowded as it wasn't the school holidays so it was quick to be seated for breakfast and plenty of space round the two excellent large pools so no problem finding a spot. As it was about 30C everyday we sat under a parasol for 5 of our 7 days and chilled out. I guess a large part of our enjoyment was the great weather.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, especially for young families

reviews.text: (If you can stir yourself do get out and see some of the Cesar Manrique sights - they're definitely worth it, as is the Volcano trip)
reviews.title: Great hotel but not 5 star
